{
  "article_text": [
    "the physics of nonequilibrium many - body systems is one of the most rapidly expanding areas which attracts much attentions recently . with the development of the modern nanoscale technology , a full understanding of the general features of thermal conduction",
    "is needed . and it is well - known that the noise @xcite generated by nanodevices contains valuable information on microscopic transport processes not available from current , which is simply related to the lowest order moment of the full distribution function for heat transfer . to this end ,",
    "the full counting statistics ( fcs ) regarding the distribution of transferred quantity , such as heat in phononic case , has to be determined .",
    "the extensive study of the fcs started from the field of electronic transport pioneered by levitov and lesovik , @xcite while much less attention is given to heat transfer .",
    "saito and dhar are the first ones to borrow this concept to thermal transport .",
    "@xcite however , both of them , including many subsequent works , are mainly restricted to noninteracting systems ,  @xcite although some works have already been devoted to the analysis of fluctuation considering the effect of nonlinearity in the classical limit through langevin simulations , or approximately in a restricted electronic transport case , such as the fcs in molecular junctions with electron - phonon interaction .",
    "@xcite    in recent years , phononics , i.e. , the counterpart technology of electronics , has great interest to both theorists and experimentalists , and presents an unforseen wealth of applications .",
    "@xcite and the nonlinearity , such as the phonon - phonon interaction , has been found of special importance in the construction of phononic devices .",
    "@xcite in addition , recently it has been noted that the nonlinearity of interaction is crucial to the manifestation of geometric heat flux .",
    "@xcite therefore , it is desirable to establish a systematic and practical formalism to properly deal with cumulants of heat transfer in the presence of nonlinearity .    in this work , we shall study the fcs for heat transfer flowing across a quantum junction in the presence of general phonon - phonon interactions .",
    "then , based on two - time observation protocol ,  @xcite we construct a concise and rigorous cumulant generating function ( cgf ) expression for the heat transfer in this general situation , in which both the transient and steady - state case are dealt with on equal footing . furthermore , as an illustration of this general formalism , a single - site junction with a quartic nonlinear on - site pinning potential is introduced and",
    "the corresponding cgf exact up to first order of the nonlinear interaction strength is given .",
    "finally , a self - consistent scheme is employed to numerically illustrate the nonlinear effects on first three cumulants of heat transfer . in short ,",
    "the paper is organized as follows .",
    "we introduce the model and elaborate the general formalism in sec .",
    "[ sec : model - and - formalism ] , which is taken as the main part of the work . and in sec .",
    "[ sec : application ] , an application is introduced to verify the general formalism . finally we summarize in sec .",
    "[ sec : summary ] .",
    "we consider the lead - junction - lead model initially prepared in a product state @xmath0 .",
    "it can be imagined that left lead @xmath1 , center junction @xmath2 , and right lead @xmath3 in this model were in contact with three different heat baths at the inverse temperatures @xmath4 , @xmath5 and @xmath6 , respectively , for time @xmath7 . at time",
    "@xmath8 , all the heat baths are removed , and couplings of the center junction with the leads @xmath9 and @xmath10 and the interested nonlinear term @xmath11 appearing only in the center junction are switched on abruptly . now",
    "the total hamiltonian is given by @xmath12 where @xmath13@xmath14 , represents coupled harmonic oscillators , @xmath15 and @xmath16 are column vectors of transformed coordinates and corresponding conjugate momenta in region @xmath17 .",
    "@xmath18 is force constant matrix ; the superscript @xmath19 stands for matrix transpose .",
    "we can construct a consistent framework  @xcite consisting of two - time quantum histories to study the heat transfer across arbitrary nonlinear systems in a given time duration .",
    "@xcite a realization of the quantum history @xmath20 means that the result of the measurement at time @xmath21 of energy of the left lead associated with the operator @xmath22 is the eigenvalue @xmath23 of @xmath22 , then the measurement at time @xmath24 yields the eigenvalue @xmath25 of @xmath22 . using this consistent quantum framework",
    ", we can define the generating function ( gf ) for heat transfer in the time duration @xmath26 to be @xmath27 where @xmath28 stands for the joint probability for the quantum history @xmath20 ; @xmath29 means evolution operator associated with the counting - field dependent total hamiltonian @xmath30 , similarly for @xmath31 and @xmath32 denotes the ensemble average over the initial state @xmath33 .    .",
    "the upper branch is called @xmath34 and lower one @xmath35 so that a particular time point @xmath36 on the upper branch is denoted by @xmath37 while @xmath38 on the lower one by @xmath39 .",
    "the time order follows the direction of the arrows .",
    "[ contour],width=307 ]    the first step for the study of the gf is to relate it to the green s function , by which the closed equation satisfied can be found out . to this end",

    "the nonlinear effects on the gf are completely included in the @xmath83 , for which we try to obtain the closed dyson equations now . to this end",
    ", we need to introduce _ the picture on the contour_. a key concept appearing in _ the picture on the contour _ is an evoulution operator @xmath84 defined on the contour @xmath43 . assuming that @xmath85 , namely @xmath38 succeeds @xmath86 on the contour , we will encounter three different situations depending on the relative position of the arguments @xmath87 and @xmath88 : @xmath89 where in the second situation we need not specify the relative magnitude of @xmath39 and @xmath37 , since the time on the lower branch always succeeds the time on the upper branch along the contour . also we should notice that the superscript @xmath34 or @xmath35 for the evolution operator simply tell us that the ordinary schrdinger evolution operator is for the upper branch or the lower branch , respectively .",

    ", we will use the same notation @xmath84 to denote the schrdinger - picture evolution operator on the contour without causing confusion , which is determined by the effective total hamiltonian @xmath94 .",

    ", accounts for the distribution of heat transfer in ballistic systems .    from now on , for notational simplicity , all the subscripts @xmath132 of the green s functions will be suppressed and the superscript @xmath133 in both @xmath122 and @xmath134 will be re - expressed as a subscript .",
    "until now , the formalism for studying the distribution of heat transport across general nonlinear junctions has been completely established . in the case of steady state ,",
    "one simply set @xmath135 and @xmath136 simultaneously , and technically assume that real - time versions of @xmath137 are time - translationally invariant .",

    "for @xmath78 in steady state could be rewritten as @xmath138\\label{eq : dlnz_omega}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] after taking into account @xmath139=\\tilde{g}^{<}\\left[\\omega\\right]^{t}$ ] and @xmath140=\\sigma_{l}^{>}\\left[\\omega\\right]^{t}$ ] . in the fourier space , due to eq .",

    "now we apply the general formalism developed above to study a single - site junction with a quartic nonlinear on - site pinning potential , that is , @xmath143 in eq .  .",
    "in this case , nonlinear contour - order self energy exact up to first order in nonlinear strength is @xmath144 , where the generalized @xmath145-function @xmath146 is the counterpart of the ordinary dirac delta function on the contour @xmath43 , see , for example , ref .  .",

    "\\times\\big[\\tilde{g}_{0}^{t}\\left(0\\right)g_{0}^{t}\\left[\\omega\\right]-\\tilde{g}_{0}^{\\bar{t}}\\left(0\\right ) & \\ ! g_{0}^{\\bar{t}}\\left[\\omega\\right]\\big]\\frac{\\partial}{\\partial\\left(i\\xi\\right)}\\frac{1}{d\\left[\\omega\\right]}\\big\\}\\label{eq : lnz_molecular}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] with @xmath149\\equiv \\det\\big[i - g_{0}\\left[\\omega\\right]\\sigma_{a}\\left[\\omega\\right]\\big]\\nonumber \\\\ & = 1\\!-\\ ! t[\\omega]\\!\\big[\\!\\left(e^{i\\xi\\hbar\\omega}\\!-\\!1\\right)\\!f_{l}\\!\\left(1\\!+\\!f_{r}\\right)\\!+\\!\\left(e^{\\!-i\\xi\\hbar\\omega}\\!-\\!1\\right)\\!f_{r}\\!\\left(1\\!+\\!f_{l}\\right)\\!\\big]\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] and @xmath150/d\\left[\\omega\\right]$ ] , where @xmath151=\\mathrm{tr}\\left(g_{0}^{r}\\gamma_{r}g_{0}^{a}\\gamma_{l}\\right)$ ] is the transmission coefficient in the ballistic system , and @xmath152 is the bose - einstein distribution function for phonons .",
    "here @xmath153 and @xmath154 are retarded and advanced green s functions , respectively .",
    "also @xmath155 $ ] , related to the spectral density of the baths , are expressed by retarded and advanced self energies similarly defined as green s functions .",
    "satisfies gallavotti - cohen symmetry @xcite for the derivatives , since @xmath156 $ ] remains invariant under the transformation @xmath157 while @xmath158/\\partial\\left(i\\xi\\right)$ ] changes sign .",
    "one could easily use this cgf in eq .   to evaluate cumulants .",
    "the steady current out of the left lead is closely related to the first cumulant so that @xmath159\\right)t\\left[\\omega\\right]\\left(f_{l}-f_{r}\\right),\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath160\\equiv3i\\hbar\\lambda g_{0}^{t}\\left(0\\right)\\left(g_{0}^{a}\\left[\\omega\\right]+g_{0}^{r}\\left[\\omega\\right]\\right)$ ] is the first - order nonlinear correction to the transmission coefficient .    the fluctuation for steady - state heat transfer in the molecular junction",
    "is obtained by taking the second derivative with respect to @xmath161 , and then setting @xmath162 : @xmath163 ( 1 + 2\\lambda[\\omega ] ) \\left(f_{l}-f_{r}\\right)^{2 } \\nonumber \\\\ & + & 3\\hbar^{2}\\lambda\\omega\\left[g_{0}^{\\bar{t}}[\\omega ] \\delta \\tilde{g}_{0}^{\\bar{t } } \\!-\\!g_{0}^{t}[\\omega ] \\delta \\tilde{g}_{0}^{t } \\right ] t[\\omega ] \\left(f_{l}-f_{r}\\right ) \\nonumber \\\\ & + & \\left(\\hbar\\omega\\right)^{2 } t[\\omega](1+\\lambda[\\omega])(f_l\\!+\\!f_r\\!+\\!2f_l f_{r})\\big\\},\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where , @xmath164\\left(f_{l}-f_{r}\\right)g_{0}^{\\bar{t},t}[\\omega].\\ ] ]    higher - order cumulants can be also systematically given by corresponding higher - order derivatives , although the expressions are messy .    in fig",
    "[ fig 1 ] , we give a numerical illustration to the first three cumulants for heat transfer in this molecular junction using a self - consistent procedure  @xcite , which means that the nonlinear contour - order self energy is taken as @xmath165 .",
    "very recently , it is shown that such self - consistent calculation gives extremely accurate results for the current in the case of a single site model as compared with master equation approach ,  @xcite thus we believe that it should leads to excellent predictions for the fcs .     for @xmath166 , @xmath167 , @xmath168 , and @xmath169 .",
    "the solid ( dotted ) line shows the self - consistent ( first - order in @xmath170 ) results for the cumulants .",
    "the temperatures of the left and right lead are 660 k and 410 k , respectively.[fig 1 ] ]    as shown , the effect of nonlinearity is to reduce the current as well as higher order fluctuations , and the fact that third and higher order cumulants are small but nonzero implies that the distribution for transferred energy is not gaussian . in this numerical illustration , the rubin baths are used , that is , @xmath171 in eq .",
    "are both the semi - infinite tridiagonal spring constant matrix consisting of @xmath172 along the diagonal and @xmath173 along the two off - diagonals . and only the nearest interaction @xmath174 and @xmath175 between the molecular and the two bathes",
    "are considered and @xmath176 . as expected , for weak nonlinearity the first - order perturbation results , presented as dotted lines , are consistent with the corresponding self - consistent ones .",
    "a formally rigorous formalism dealing with cumulants of heat transfer across nonlinear quantum junctions is established based on field theoretical and negf methods .",
    "the cgf for the heat transfer in both transient and steady - state regimes is studied on an equal footing and useful formulas for the cgf are obtained .",
    "a new feature of this formalism is that counting - field dependent full green s function @xmath83 can be expressed solely through the nonlinear term @xmath177 with the help of an interaction - picture transformation defined on a contour .",
    "although we focus on the distribution of heat transfer in pure nonlinear phononic systems , there is no doubt that this general formalism can be readily employed to handle any other nonlinear systems , such as electron - phonon interaction and joule heating problems . up to the first order in the nonlinear strength for the single - site quartic model ,",
    "the cgf for steady - state heat transfer is obtained and explicit results for the steady current and fluctuation of steady - state heat transfer are given . a self - consistent procedure , which works well for strong nonlinearity , is also introduced to numerically check our general formalism .",
    "we thank juzar thingna , lifa zhang and sha liu for insightful discussions .",
    "this work is supported in part by urc grant no .",
    "r-144 - 000 - 285 - 646 , and r-144 - 000 - 300 - 112 .",
    "in this appendix , we give sufficient conditions for the wick theorem to be valid which covers most of the situation we encounter .",
    "the discussion is limited to the case of bosonic operators which is the main interest in this paper .",
    "we mainly extend gaudin s approach .",
    "@xcite for an alternative proof , one can resort ro the ref .  .",
    "first we explain what the wick theorem is .",
    "the wick theorem says that the average value of a product of creation and annihilation operators is equal to the sum of all complete systems of pairings , mathematically which can be stated as @xmath178 and then applying this relation recursively to all of the multiple operator averages until only pairs of operators remain .",
    "now we explore the sufficient conditions for the wick theorem to be justified , which simply means that eq .",
    "( [ eq : wick s theorem ] ) is valid .",
    "suppose the system s degrees of freendom is @xmath179 , and we define @xmath180 where @xmath181 and @xmath182 are annihilation and creation operators respectively .",
    "assume @xmath183 where @xmath184 are @xmath185-numbers .",
    "we prove the wick theorem for @xmath186 , which is shown below : @xmath187\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } + \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\alpha_{i_{1}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\nonumber\\\\   & = & \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\right]\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } + \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\right]\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\nonumber\\\\   & + & \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\alpha_{i_{1}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\nonumber\\\\   & = & \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\right]\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } + \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\right]\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\nonumber\\\\   &   + & \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{4}}\\right]\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\}\\nonumber\\\\   & + & \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\alpha_{i_{4}}\\alpha_{i_{1}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\nonumber\\\\   & = & \\cdots\\nonumber\\\\   & = & \\sum_{j=2}^{s}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{j}}\\right]\\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{1}}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\cdots\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{j}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\}\\nonumber \\\\   &   + & \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\alpha_{i_{1}}\\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\}\\nonumber \\\\   & = & \\sum_{j=2}^{s}\\left[\\alpha_{i_{1}},\\:\\alpha_{i_{j}}\\right]\\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{1}}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\cdots\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{j}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\nonumber\\\\   &   + & \\sum_{k=1}^{2f}h_{i_{1}k}\\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\alpha_{k}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\alpha_{i_{3}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the circle over the operator means that this operator is omitted .",
    "then @xmath188\\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{1}}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\cdots\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{j}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] multiply by the inverse matrix @xmath189 , we can get @xmath190\\right\\}\\!\\ ! \\mathrm{tr}\\left\\ { \\rho^{ini}\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{1}}\\alpha_{i_{2}}\\cdots\\overset{\\circ}{\\alpha}_{i_{j}}\\cdots\\alpha_{i_{s}}\\right\\ } \\label{eq : intermidiate}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] after considering the special case @xmath191,\\ ] ] we obtain from eq .",
    "( [ eq : intermidiate ] ) @xmath192        in the following , we try to figure out the form of initial density matrix @xmath197 satisfying eq .",
    "( [ eq : condition1 ] ) , which turns out to be @xmath198 with @xmath199 to be a general square matrix .",
    "we neglect the normalization constant for @xmath196 here . to this end , we split the @xmath199 to be a symmetrical part and an anti - symmetrical part , that is @xmath200 let us define @xmath201 in obtaining the second equality , notice that @xmath202 is a @xmath185-number due to @xmath203=\\begin{pmatrix}1 & 0\\\\ 0 & -1 \\end{pmatrix}$ ] and @xmath204 .",
    "thus @xmath205e^{-t\\frac{1}{2}\\alpha^{t}a^{s}\\alpha}\\\\   & = & -\\sum_{j}\\left(\\sigma a^{s}\\right)_{ij}f_{j}\\left(t\\right),\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath206 . so @xmath207 and @xmath208 or equivalently @xmath209 more generally , the multiplication of finite number of the form of eq .",
    "( [ eq : quadratic ] ) still satisfies eq .",
    "( [ eq : condition1 ] ) , such as @xmath210 which is shown below : @xmath211    due to the sufficient conditions presented in this appendix , the wick theorem used in this paper for the feynman - diagrammatic analysis is justified .",

    ". j. b * 62 * , 381 ( 2008 ) ; j .- s .",
    "wang , b. k. agarwalla , h. li , and j. thingna , arxiv : 1303.7317 .",
    "g. gallavotti and e. g. d. cohen .",
    "* 74 * , 2694 ( 1995 ) .",
    "t .- h . park and m. galperin , phys .",
    "b * 84 * , 205450 ( 2011 ) .",
    "d. he and j. thingna , private communication , see also j. thingna , j. l. garca - palacios , and j .- s .",
    "wang , phys .",
    "b * 85 * , 195452 ( 2012 ) .",
    "m. gaudin , nucl .",
    "phys.*15 * , 89 ( 1960 ) . j .-",
    "blaizot and g. ripka , _ quantum theory of finite systems _",
    "( massachusetts : mit press , 1986 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we consider thermal conduction across a general nonlinear phononic junction . based on two - time observation protocol and the field theoretical / algebraic method , </S>",
    "<S> the cumulants of the heat transferred in both transient and steady - state regimes are studied on an equal footing , and practical formulae for the calculation of the cumulant generating function of heat transfer are obtained . as an application , the developed general formalism is used to study anharmonic effects on fluctuation of steady - state heat transfer across a single - site junction with a quartic nonlinear on - site pinning potential . </S>",
    "<S> an explicit nonlinear modification to cumulant generating function exact up to the first order is given , in which gallavotti - cohen fluctuation symmetry is verified . </S>",
    "<S> numerically a self - consistent procedure is introduced , which works well for strong nonlinearity . </S>"
  ]
}
